page.title: 05The Longshaw Estate
page.content: The Longshaw Estate is now owned by the National Trust and covers some 1500 acres. From the Grindleford to Fox House road can be seen the dark and imposing Longshaw Lodge and its Chapel. The Lodge now houses private apartments, and was once a hunting lodge for the Dukes of Rutland. The public footpath passes close to the front of the Lodge and between this and the small gatehouse are the welcoming cafe, giftshop and Information Centre which are very popular with locals and tourists alike, particularly with weekend walkers, as the home made snacks are to be recommended. Much of the land is used for sheep grazing and comprises streams, grassland, moorland and woods.
